info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 18 at 5:03PM MST until July 18 at 7:00PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, southwestern Cochise.
* WHEN...Until 700 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 458 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated between 0.50 and 0.75 inches of heavy rain has fallen across portions of southern Cochise county. Rainfall runoff has resulted in running water in normally dry washes and significant ponding of water in roadway dips and other low-lying area near Douglas. Storms continue to develop spread west and will impact southwest Cochise county, including the city of Sierra Vista over the next few hours. Expect small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sierra Vista, Douglas, Bisbee, Hereford, Whetstone, Huachuca City, Tombstone, Naco, Fort Huachuca, Bisbee-Douglas Airport, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Parker Canyon Lake, Palominas, Pirtleville, Elfrida, McNeal, Charleston, Fairbank, Coronado National Memorial and Ramsey Canyon Preserve. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MST THIS EVENING
